body.name: Fry Pan with Lid, 3-ply Skillet, 18/8 Stainless Steel, Induction Ready, Dishwasher Safe, Silver (8-Inch)
body.stockDetail: Only 10 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 56 mins
features: We found the manufacturer who produces for Zwilling and WMF, to produce this product. The same techniques, machines and material standard are applied, which ensures the quality.

Tri-ply bonded construction consists of double stainless steel encapsulating an aluminum core for even heating throughout and stunning quality. You could find out how 3-ply stainless steel pan performs on video sites.

Highly polished 18/8 stainless-steel cooking surface is durable and it won’t react with food. 18/8 stainless steel lid; casting stainless steel handles permanently secured with stainless steel rivets. Rims are tapered for drip-free pouring. Unbreakable stainless steel lid prevents oil from splattering. Oven resistant.
You don’t need to worry about any safety issues compared to non-stick coating pans, such as coating peeling and release of harmful substances.

This product performs better than single-ply stainless steel pans do in terms of stick resistance. In our tests, this pan fries eggs perfectly with olive oil over low heat. But meat sticks relatively easily. Not good for rice and pancakes.
The handle is compact and exquisite. In our tests, it is very comfortable to hold the handle in different ways, provides you with precise control of the pan. It fits both big hands and small hands.
Easy to clean with detergent and sponge. Dry it after cleaning to avoid water marks. Dishwasher safe.
Please do not use hard tools to cook or clean, which may cause scratches on the surface.
Perfect for frying eggs or cooking pasta serving 1-2 persons.
Enjoy this professional skillet while paying less. We think it is one of the best deals on the market.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: "We love a peaceful and comfortable life. We aim to offer customers products of great quality and design. We strive for 5-star products and reviews."

OUR IDEAS 10.6-QT Pasta Pot The manufacturer of this product also produces for famous cookware brands such as Zwilling J. A. Henckels and WMF. Belly-shape pot and extra-high insert prevent water and foam from overflowing. 8-Inch Fry Pan, Tri-Ply 3-ply bonded construction consists of double stainless steel encapsulating an aluminum core for even heating throughout. Equipped with unbreakable stainless steel lid prevents oil from splattering. 10-Inch Fry Pan, Tri-Ply You don’t need to worry about any safety issue compared to non-stick coating pans and it performs better than single-ply stainless steel pans do in terms of stick resistance. 4-QT Saucepan, Tri-Ply We tested over 50 handles and finally selected this one, which is the most comfortable and surprised us. Permanently secured with advanced welding technology. Say goodbye to stains around rivets.

OUR PRODUCTS "We emphasize value creation and always think about what we can do to make our products perfect. Our design team focuses on kitchen essentials to bring our expertise to customers. Our global sourcing team keeps finding OEM factories of famous brands to ensure quality."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Stainless Pan
reviews.reviewText: This is my second time buying this pan. This is a gift for my daughter. It is a great size not too heavy especially if you have some limited mobility in your hand or wrist. If you know anything about stainless, you want to heat this up and get some water beads dancing across it before adding any fats or food product. I do everything from stakes to eggs in here and never have a problem. A quick two to 5 minutes soak and all of the food debris comes off. Also washed it in the dishwasher with no issues. With a lid as well. This came in a larger size. Love this pan. Great value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: An unbelievable value combined with good performance. I largely own only All-Clad (expensive but good to very good performance) and Demeyere Atlantis Proline Pans (extremely expensive but superb performance). I needed a small fry pan but couldn't stomach another hundred dollars plus from any of the above sources.What a surprise! This 8 inch fry pan came in a box worthy of being a wedding gift; it was unusually heavy (a good sign) and finally seemed to cook evenly. I doubt it will cook as evenly as any of my favorites but that might prove impossible to notice given the pans' small size. I'm pleased with this pan but I'd be reluctant to even try their 10" pan given the relatively thin 3 layers they employ.It is a small pan; it can accommodate the largest burger imaginable but not two small burgers side by side if that makes sense. A salmon filet for one, etc. It measures at the very bottom of the cooking surface 5 3/4 inches across. At the top, as advertised, it is 8 inches across.A superb value

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect For One
reviews.reviewText: First, the packaging of this product is superior. The box it comes in is also made of a sturdy material. The chances of this pan getting damaged, during shipping and handling, is extremely low. This 8", 3/ply stainless steel frying pan, with a stainless steel lid and high rim, is exactly what I wanted for making an omelet, or frying a large egg or small piece of meat or fish, for one person. It's extremely well made with a handle that will never detach and it looks beautiful. I've been a fan of stainless steel cookware forever. It never bends if dropped, it always looks new and the metal cleans easily. Just Put water in it and let soak for at least 30 mins. Food will detach easily. I'm going to purchase their 10" frying pan, next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy duty pan and lid
reviews.reviewText: It feels like a heavy duty and durable stainless steel pan. It quite literally is a bit heavy compared to my previous aluminum ceramic coated pan so if weight is a problem I would take that into account. The heat distribution is very even and the handle nor lid handle does not get hot. As with frying on any stainless steel pan, it becomes difficult to clean especially if you do not preheat ur meats or oil properly. On top of that, it generally takes slightly longer for me to cook meals with stainless steel. It does get slight scratch marks since I need to use scouring side of sponge sometimes. However I switched to steel since I do not want the coating (ceramic or teflon) of standard pans potentially peeling off into my food. Therefore the benefits outweigh the negatives so far. It seems like it will last for years or decades, which is really nice compared to coated aluminum pans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic fry pan. I use it daily for cooking breakfast and it has done a wonderful job. It still looks brand new and shiny after around 2 months of daily use. Great quality and a very reasonably priced for an induction ready pan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This pan exceeded my expectations. Heats evenly, oil stays in the middle and cooks well. About once a week, I boil white vinegar in the pan for a deep clean. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fortune Cookie 8” Tri Ply Stainless Steel Frying Pan
reviews.reviewText: I like to cook with tri ply stainless steel pans, and have usually purchased them from professional restaurant supply companies, which are often fairly expensive pans, just to have a cover for the pan. A premium maker of stainless steel pans for home use does not even have a cover for their smaller pans.The 8” Fortune Cookie fry pan was completely surprising for two reasons.1- the low cost, since I was prepared to spend quite a bit more.2- the weight of the pan. Frying pans used in commercial kitchens are often 8 or 10 guage, which are very thick. A decent pan for home use is 14 guage. I am guessing that the Fortune Cookie frying pan is 14 guage.Although the pan is not a heavily used pan, it fits my needs perfectly.It turns out that the lid to this frying pan also fits the All-Clad 8” non stick frying pan, for which a lid is not available. A frittata, is more easily made in a nonstick frying pan. I use the Fortune Cookie frying pan for poaching eggs in tomato sauces which may ultimately eroded the cooking surface of nonstick pans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A great find The perfect size & paired with a lid Lids are usually not offered skillets of this small size I love it!
Heavy enough stainless steel pan which you can leave soak in water and it wont rust like the old cast iron one did.Good quality

reviews.reviewTitle: No está mal, pero se sigue pegando
reviews.reviewText: Buena aceptación del calor, no obstante tiene deficiencias en la superficie, se siguen pegando los alimentos.
